title: N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 12 §§ 23-10.3 - Maintenance of engines
content:
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 12 §§ 23-10.3 - Maintenance of engines

State Regulations

All internal combustion engines and their accessories
shall, as far as is practicable, be kept in such repair and adjustment as to
create no gases other than those incidental to normal operation. Gaskets, manifold, mufflers, exhaust piping and all connections shall be maintained free
of leaks and secured against displacement. Notes
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 12
§§
23-10.3

State regulations are updated quarterly; we currently have two versions available. Below is a
comparison between our most recent version and the prior quarterly release. More comparison features will be added as we have more versions to compare. No prior version found.
